context: However in many Turkish cities the concentration of these pollutants were known to be above these limits. National legislation also regulates the 8-month winter period urban air quality as 250 μg/m3 for SO2 and 200 μg/m3 for PM (MOE 1986). Table 1 summarizes the air quality limits according to this regulation, its probable revision, WHO (Europe-1996) guidelines, and EC regulations (Leeuwen, 1997). Turkish Air Quality Protection Regulation was based on WHO (Europe-1996) air quality criteria which suggests use of SO2 limits of 500 μg/m3 (10-min average), 125 μg/m3 (24-h average), 50 μg/m3 (annual average). For PM new WHO criteria does not propose any guideline. To estimate the amount of past, present, and future pollutant, an emission inventory to cover Turkey was prepared. Methods used for preparing this inventory was similar to the method used in the GENEMIS subproject (EUROTRAC, 1991) of EUROTRAC (EUREKA) project of the European Community.
